doc: PLEASE READ: FILLING IN THE TEMPLATE IS REQUIRED!
Issues that do not include enough information might not be picked up.
By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect.
Please prefix your issue with one of the following: [BUG] [PROPOSAL] [QUESTION].
Put an X between the brackets if you have done the following:
* [x] Able to reproduce the behaviour outside of your code, the problem is isolated to Laravel Excel.
* [x] Checked that your issue isn't already filed.
* [x] Checked if no PR was submitted that fixes this problem.
<!-- Please be as exact and complete as possible when proving version numbers -->

Trailing zeroes are being removed from my columns. I have looked into this and it seems the fix is to use TYPE_STRING on the column. I am currently using the exportable format (with WithColumnFormatting, WithHeadings, WithMapping) but I can't find a concern that will allow me to set the DataType of the columns/cells. Is this currently possible? or do I need to access the underlying library directly?
